intro: Ayenia andamensis, commonly known as the Andaman ayenia, is a flowering plant native to the Andaman Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking pink to red flowers that bloom during the rainy season. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Ayenia andamensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to the tropical rainforest ecosystem.
